result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Feisthauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph Feisthauer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph Feisthauer was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Joseph Feisthauer was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Deceased
Copy of Diploma from St. Croix Valley Academy of Virtual Education.
signed by Defendant and Atty. Peterson.
from Hudson Hospital and Clinic advising Defendant completed the Programs for Change Primary Treatment.

01:15 PM Defendant Joseph Feisthauer in Court with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  DA Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes Sentencing on 16CM63 and Plea/Sentencing on 17CF47 & 17CF186.  DA Froelich recites agreement.  Advises Amended Informations (2) in 17CF186 and Amended Information in 17CF47.  Recites agreements; On 17CF186: One Count One, G.  Sentence W/H.  3 years Probation.  30 days conditional time w/EHM.  $518.  DNA.  On Count Two, G.  W/H.  One year Probation.  30 days conditional time w/EHM.  Concurrent.  Credit for 34 days.  $443.  On 17CF47: Sole Count, G.  W/H.  One year Probation.  30 days conditional time w/EHM.  Concurrent to 17CF186.  $443.  Credit for 35 days.  On 16CM63 (Revocation of DJOC): W/H.  One year Probation.  Concurrent to 17CF47 and 17CF186.  Atty. Peterson and Defendant confirm agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the Court; Court reviews with Defendant.  Constitutional rights explained to Defendant.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count One of 17CF47.  Atty. Peterson stipulates to facts.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Court finds Defendant Guilty and adjudicates Guilty.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count One of 17CF186.  Atty. Peterson stipulates to facts.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Court finds Defendant Guilty and adjudicates Guilty.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count Two of 17CF186.  Atty. Peterson stipulates to facts.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Court finds Defendant Guilty and adjudicates Guilty.  DA Froelich states position.  Atty. Peterson states argument.  Defendant makes statement.  Court questions Defendant.  Court sentences Defendant:
On 17CF47: Count One.  Sentence W/H.  One year Probation.  Specific conditions to be set by Agent.  $443.  Credit for 35 days if revoked from Probation.  Eligible for expungment if probation is successfully completed.    
On 17CF186 Count One: Sentence W/H.  3 years Probation.  Specific conditions to be set by Agent.  $518.  Concurrent to 17CF47.  34 days credit.  Eligible for expungment if probation is successfully completed.    
On Count Two:  W/H.  One year Probation.  Specific conditions to be set by Agent.  Concurrent w/Count One and 17CF47.  Credit for 34 days.  $443.  Eligible for expungment if probation is successfully completed.    
On 16CM63, Count Three:  W/H.  One year Probation.  Specific conditions to be set by Agent.  Concurrent to 17CF47 and 17CF186.  Court will not impose Court Costs.  53 days credit.  Eligible for expungment if probation is successfully completed.            
On Count Three:  W/H.  One year Probation.  Specific conditions to be set by Agent.  Concurrent to 17CF47 and 17CF186.  Court will not impose Court Costs.  53 days credit.    Eligible for expungment if probation is successfully completed.
Appeal rights are given to the defendant.  Adjourned at 1:48 PM

Hearing on May 4, 2017 at 08:45 am.
To revoke the Defered JOC

1:45 Attorney Christopher R. Bub in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel agree to amend the bond to removed the curfew conditions. Court approves the agreement and removes the curfew from the bond but all other conditions remain.

10:44 a.m.  Defendant Joseph Feisthauer in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 16CM40, 16CM63 and 16FO55.  O'Sullivan - moves to dismiss 16CF13, dismiss 16CM40, dismiss Counts 1 and 2 of 16CM63, accept guilty plea on counts 3 and 4 of 16CM63 and dismiss 16FO55. 2 year judgment of conviction on Counts 3 and 4 of 16CM63.   Bub would like modifications to bond conditions of curfew and UA.  State would stipulate to removal of curfew.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Counts 3 and 4 of 16CM63.   Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 3 and 4 of 16CM63 and witholds judgment of conviction.  Court dismisses 16CM13, 16CM40, Counts 1 and 2 of 16CM63 and 16FO55.  Court approves and signs 2 year deferred agreement.

3:58 Defendant Joseph Feisthauer  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub appeared via phone.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM40, 16CM13 followed along. Motion to modify bond filed by Atty Bub. Atty OSullivan has no objection to modify cash bond to a $1,000 signature bond with conditions. Atty Bub agrees to all but 1 condition requested.
for Bond Modification filed by Atty Bub

04:45 16CM13 and 16CM63 also heard at this time. Defendant Joseph Feisthauer not in court.  Defendant in custody.  Atty Christopher Bub appears for defendant.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bub: requests review of bonds, reduce to signature bond.  O'Sullivan: objects to reducing to signature bond, defendant does not have a place to go, too many bail jumping charges.  Court questions Attorney Bub regarding defendant's living situation. Court questions defendant's mother regarding living situation. Court:  denies any amendments to the bonds at this time. 04:58
Status conference on June 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.
State's
Christopher Bub
Pre-trial conference on April 7, 2016 at 04:15 pm.

Defendant Joseph Feisthauer appears in Court with Attorney Liesl Nelson via phone.  ADA William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 3:49 p.m.  Includes 16CM63 and 16FO55.  Court advises Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and waives further reading.  Atty. Nelson enters NG plea on all counts.  State recommends $400 cash bond, noting two pending misd. cases.  Atty. Nelson requests signature bond, noting Defendant lives with parents and has a job.  Court addresses 16FO55, Atty. Nelson enters NG plea.  Court sets all cases for same date/time as other cases. Defendant Joseph Feisthauer in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 04:15 pm.
